conclusion: Determine the acceleration of the mover-aircraft assembly while it is pushed forward
The velocity increases uniformly from 0 to v₁ = 80 m/s in t₁ = 1.5 s. Acceleration a = Δv / Δt = 80 m/s / 1.5 s = 53.33 m/s².
Find the magnetic driving force during the forward run
Total mass being accelerated m_total = m (mover + coil) + M (aircraft) = 5 kg + 10 kg = 15 kg.
Using Newton’s second law, F_m = m_total · a = 15 kg × 53.33 m/s² ≈ 800 N.
Relate the magnetic force to the coil current
For a straight conductor in a perpendicular magnetic field, the force is F_m = n I l B, where n = 100 turns, l = 1 m, B = 0.10 T, and I = constant current to be found.
The constant-current power supply must deliver I = 80 A.
